intro: Monnina richardiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf monnina, is a herbaceous annual plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a velvety texture and a bluish-green hue. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Monnina richardiana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
